definition: to enjoy/to reap the benefits (of sth)
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.chinese: 养成好习惯，一辈子受用不尽。

sentences.english: This will have provided them one of the longest lasting gifts you could give them.
sentences.chinese: 这将是一份你能给予他们的一生都受用的礼物。

sentences.english: A word of admiration holds more value for her than compliments.
sentences.chinese: 于她而言，一句真诚赞美比恭维话要受用的多。
而这种成熟，会受用终身。

sentences.english: Words of appreciation aren't half-bad either.
sentences.chinese: 感激的话语总是很受用的。

sentences.english: Well, this is one challenge you should definitely enjoy.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，这就是一个让你绝对受用的跳战。

sentences.english: The Law of Reciprocity is strong in people.
sentences.chinese: 互惠主义的原则在人群中是十分受用的。

sentences.english: I think reading is important in the whole life for people.
sentences.chinese: 我认为阅读对人们来说是终身受用的。

sentences.english: Our minds love it when we ask ourselves questions.
sentences.chinese: 当我们问自己问题时，我们的头脑很受用。

sentences.english: Mr. Wong understands something that Lakers fans found out long ago, and the lesson remains relevant to this day.
sentences.chinese: 王先生从湖人球迷那儿吸取教训，直至今日任然受用。

sentences.english: That is the beauty of being alone. For the moment, just let me indulge in this profusion of moonlight and lotus fragrance.
sentences.chinese: 这是独处的妙处，我且受用这无边的荷香月色好了。

sentences.english: Spend a little time now learning a time-saving trick or shortcut that you can use over and over again in the future.
sentences.chinese: 花一点时间学个让你将来一直受用的省时技巧或捷径。

sentences.english: This speech really very much enjoys, valuable, you know?
sentences.chinese: 这句话真得很受用，宝，你知道吗？

sentences.english: Her motto, "Be effective and efficient" has motivated Fung Yi throughout her life.
sentences.chinese: “既要效率，亦要效益”是凤儿终身受用的座右铭。

sentences.english: But if you get it right, in both instances women are really impressed.
sentences.chinese: 不过要是你时机把握正确，对于两者美眉都会很受用。

definition: to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
to receive instruction/to benefit from advice
to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
